question: A train covers a distance of 10 km in 12 minutes. If its speed is decreased by 5 km/hr, the time taken by it to cover the same distance is equal to :
explanation:
Time = 12 minutes $latex = \\frac{12}{60}\\ hours = \\frac{1}{5}\\ hours&s=1$
Speed of train = 
$latex = \\frac{10}{\\frac{1}{5}} = 50\\ km/hr&s=1$
New speed  = 50 - 5 = 45 km/hr
$latex \\therefore Required\\ Time = \\frac{Distance}{Speed}&s=1$
$latex = \\frac{10}{45} = \\frac{2}{9}\\ hour&s=1$
$latex = \\frac{2}{9}\\times 60 = = \\frac{40}{3}\\ minutes&s=1$
Hence option [C] is correct answer.
